messages.message:
For folks looking for a “simple” architecture diagram of how our services interact with each other here is a nice visualization built based on network policies: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1VrjZs6ydLVJo7fu7rohz5U7Uvl1oSKqR/view

:hat-tip: @Yan Wang
Wow! was it always that simple?
I also tried to create infrastructure digram based upon our Terraform modules, but it was way too simple so I skipped it.

I’ve got something much better :stuck_out_tongue:
This is based on real time traffic. You can check this out here - https://app.groundcover.com/network-map?start=&end=&duration=Last+6+hours&clusterId=ib-dogfood&namespaces=instabase-dogfood&freeText=
what are we using this?  And can we get this deployed in our SaaS environments as well?

This is an observability tool called groundcover. https://www.groundcover.com/
They provide end-2-end observability offering (logs, stats and traces) with zero instrumentation.

I have been running this as a POC in dogfood for few months now, and it’s a free plan.
We can deploy this in SaaS but it’ll cost somewhat. Attaching their pricing plans.
c.c. @sudeep
I can demo (telemetry from dogfood) what they offer using their UI if you are interested to check this out.

Here is another tool - https://kiali.io/ is a istio dashboard which can also do similar visualisation and distributed tracing and it’s free and open source. If we going to use istio for SaaS envs then we can also take a look into it,

@shaunak jfyi - Groundcover is based off ebpf and we never took it forward because of customer feasibility - but we have been picking some ideas and implementing into our product over time.  if we like it we can always use it for SaaS envs because the infra is in our control and we can get perms needed to run ebpf based solution.
